text: a lot of people have positioned this
debate as you know just a battle between
the tech industry and the content
industry and uh it's it's an Insider
game it's a bunch of Rich guys playing
you know around with each other I don't
think that's the case I think what we're
talking about is um the freedom to
innovate that's a very profound uh and
important thing first of all all of the
services that that
consumers across the web have come to
know and love you know there are 800
million people using Facebook the future
of those Services is at risk and so your
use of the internet is threatened by
this legislation if the legislation
passes it'll mean that you will pay more
for a lot of the things that you've come
to uh appreciate and and that have been
much much less expensive beyond that
there's Innovation and there's the the
the pace of innovation slowing down the
next Facebook the next novel service
that consumers would get really excited
about is is not going to happen you know
today one of the reasons the internet
has produced such wonderful Innovation
is that it's been very inexpensive to
start a company for square got to
100,000 users on
$25,000 that's unheard of in an era
before the open source software that
everybody uses to build on top of and
the distribution platform called the
internet which the end users pay for you
know we all buy our our our access to
the internet ourselves and so no uh no
no supplier of content has to buy the
access the way they used to in the cable
world and so by lowering the cost of of
creating new new Services we've
dramatically increase the amount of
innovation the problem is you know four
squares essentially started with three
people and they were able to get to
100,000 users with five or six people um
now we're going to have three people and
a lawyer uh involved in all of these
startups because uh as an investor we're
going to be looking at these and the
first due diligence question you're
going to ask is you are you clean is
there any risk associated with liability
you know could uh one of these people
come after you could the Attorney
General come after you what are you
doing that might infringe and the
definitions in this legislation are so
vague that they no no matter how hard
they try they're not going to be able to
give crisp answers to that so it creates
a a huge amount of uncertainty which
will chill investment which will chill
Innovation the real irony here is if you
had to pick the content industry's least
favorite company it'd probably be Google
what's happening here is that Google has
about 200 lawyers on staff today it's
not going to affect them at all they'll
fight these guys they have the money
they have the lawyers they'll just you
know create a team and go fight these
guys but if you take a little search
engine startup like Duck ducko which
helps to compete with Google which is
innovating in in novel ways and creating
a new experience for consumers they have
three people if the fourth one has to be
a lawyer they're never going to get
there and the last thing is to come back
to this notion of the freedom to
innovate and why is that so important we
have a bunch of really difficult
problems that we're facing over the next
few years and politicians sometimes say
why are you spending time on on this
issue it's an Arcane Insider issue um
but if you think about the problems that
we're trying to solve the Internet isn't
the problem the internet is the solution
so just think about um the fact that no
matter what we're going to go through a
period of dislocation as the economy
evolves into this more modern on this
more modern platform and people who are
in their 40s are going to have to
rethink you know how they're making a
living they're probably going to have to
be more dependent on themselves they're
going to have to find ways of retraining
themselves the way to do that is to use
the internet to to make it possible if
the the idea of retraining workers is
done as a part of a government service
through a government institution in the
old industrial hierarchical bureaucratic
model of delivering those Services it's
going to be phenomenally expensive what
we're seeing on the internet is really
Nifty education startups where peers are
teaching years how how how to do things
the cost of that is a tiny fraction of
the cost of the old industrial model of
producing these services so we need this
medium to get us through these really
intractable problems so it's not just a
little you know inside baseball argument
between two Rich Kids you know it is it
is a threat to the foundation of the
internet which in turn is a threat to
the Innovation that we need to dig
ourselves out of these these these
really difficult problems
